result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W Kohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Commencing forthwith.     
If sentence credit is requested and granted by Court, it is to be applied to Count #1, if revoked.  

7/20/2017 - COURT GRANTS SENTENCE CREDIT OF 103 DAYS, IF REVOKED.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Costs paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Maintain full time employment and/or school combination or any other activity deemed appropriate by Agent. 
  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
The FIRST 30 DAYS to be served STRAIGHT TIME.  

The balance of condition time is STAYED for the Defendant to participate in inpatient treatment at Rosecrance followed by sober living house.  The Defendant is only to be released from jail for direct admittance into Rosecrance after the initial 30 days straight time.  Upon completion of Rosecrance, the defendant is to reside at a sober living house.  If sober living house is not available upon completion of Rosecrance, the defendant is to be housed in custody at the Waukesha County Huber Facility until sober living house becomes available.
Perform a TOTAL of 100 hours of Community Service.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS Eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant Jason W Kohl in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Elizabeth Babe.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 3. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Counts #2 and #4 are dismissed and read in to counts #1 and #3.  The Defendant is to remain in custody and will appear at Treatment Court this afternoon.

Defendant Jason W Kohl in court with attorney Katherine Lindgren for Katie Elizabeth Babe.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court addresses the Defendant's non-compliance with WCS.  Attorney Lindgren advises the Court the Defendant has enrolled intensive outpatient treatment and requests the bail remain as set.  The State requests the Court increase cash bail.  The Court orders the defendant comply with treatment and make all meetings.  The Court gives the Defendant one final warning.  The Defendant is to continue the outpatient intensive treatment.  The Court quashes the warrant.
